intro: Urostigma costaricanum, commonly known as the Costa Rican starwort, is a herbaceous plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish or purplish hue. Urostigma costaricanum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
